law.catch_line: This section applies only to a golf course that is:...

text.section:
This section applies only to a golf course that is:
Located on land that is owned by Baltimore City; and
Operated by a Baltimore City golf course manager or a golf course manager under a management agreement with Baltimore City.

section.section: The Board of Liquor License Commissioners for Baltimore City may issue a special Class M-G beer, wine and liquor license for use at a municipal golf course.
The Class M-G license may be issued to a golf course manager.

text.section: A Class M-G license may be used to sell beer, wine, and liquor for consumption only on the land and in the facilities used for golfing purposes.

section.section: The licensee may designate an agent to sell beer, wine, and liquor at the golf course.
The agent shall be considered the vendor for collecting and remitting the sales and use tax.

text.section: On request of Baltimore City and subject to § 10-503(d) of this article, the Board of Liquor License Commissioners for Baltimore City may transfer a Class M-G license to a different golf course manager.
The Board of Liquor License Commissioners for Baltimore City shall adopt regulations to carry out this section.
